content.prompt:
The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 8 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 6 to 8 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from top to bottom:

  • The curve enters the window at (0.4 comma 8.5).
  • The curve decreases from right to left, passing through point A at (negative 1 comma 6.7) and gradually becoming vertical at (negative 1.7 comma 4.5).
  • The curve decreases from left to right, passing through point B at (negative 1 comma 2.2).
  • The curve continues to decrease from left to right, passing through (0 comma 1.7) and (2 comma 0.9).
  • When the curve reaches the point (2.9 comma 0), it is vertical and changes directions, decreasing from right to left.
  • When the curve reaches the point (2.4 comma negative 1.3), it is vertical and changes directions, decreasing from left to right.
  • The curve passes through (3 comma negative 2.4), (5 comma negative 3.9), and exits the window at (8.5 comma negative 5.9).

In the xy-plane, the graph of an implicitly defined function curve is given along with the two labeled points A and B. Which of the following describes the curve?

choices.label: For pairs of points near A, the ratio of the change in x and the change in y is positive, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.
For pairs of points near A, the ratio of the change in x and the change in y is negative, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.
For pairs of points near B, the ratio of the change in x and the change in y is positive, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.
For pairs of points near B, the ratio of the change in x and the change in y is negative, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
